p: The bacteriostatic effect of Anchusa strigosa lipid fraction against selected strains of bacterial pathogens has been investigated by Al-Juobory et al. and showed that it was more effective against Gram-positive bacterial strains compared with the Gram-negatives. The antibacterial activity results against Gram-positive strains were in the flowing sequent: S. faecalis > S. aureus > Bacillus sp., while the effect against Gram-negative was as follows: P. aeruoginosa > Proteus sp. > E. coli > Enterobacter sp. > Klebsiella sp. [ 35]. On the other hand, Anchusa strigosa essential oil exhibited potent antibacterial activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, especially in a high concentration (2 and 5 mg/ml) [ 36].
